description: Name of artist.
Color of the border. Can be black, borderless, gold, silver, or white.
List of all colors in card’s mana cost, rules text and any color indicator.
List of all colors in card’s color indicator (a symbol showing the colors of the card). Usually found only on cards without mana costs and other special cards.
List of all colors in card’s mana cost and any color indicator. Some cards are special (such as Devoid cards or other cards with certain rules text).
The converted mana cost of the card.
If the card is in a duel deck product, can be "a" or "b". (If not in duel deck product, duelDeck is usually ommitted.)
The converted mana cost of the face (half, or part) of the card.

example: "Whatever hatred destroys, a single act of trust can revive."
description: Italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.
Italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.

Effect found on the card frame style. Can be legendary, miracle, nyxtouched, draft, devoid, tombstone, colorshifted, sunmoondfc, compasslanddfc, originpwdfc, or mooneldrazidfc. (If none, it is usually omitted.)
Version of the card frame style. Can be 1993, 1997, 2003, 2015, or future.
Starting maximum hand size total modifier. A plus or minus character preceeds an integer. Used only on Vanguard cards.
Can the card be found in foil? Can be true or false. (If false, it is usually omitted.)
Can the card be found in non-foil? Can be true or false. (If false, it is usually omitted.)
Is the card only available online? Can be true or false. (If false, it is usually omitted.)
Is the card oversized? Can be true or false. (If false, it is usually omitted.)
Card is “timeshifted”, a feature from Time Spiral block. Can be true or false. (If false, it is usually omitted.)
Type of card. Can be normal, split, flip, transform, meld, leveler, saga, planar, scheme, vanguard, token, double_faced_token, emblem, augment, or host. (If normal, it is usually omitted.)
Magic play formats.
Starting life total modifier. A plus or minus character preceeds an integer. Used only on Vanguard cards.
Planeswalker loyalty value.
Mana cost of the card.
An integer most cards have which Wizards uses as a card identifier.
Name of the card. (If the card is in an Un-set and has multiple printings, a space and letter enclosed in parentheses, starting with (b), follows the name.)

example: ["Nicol Bolas, the Ravager","Nicol Bolas, the Arisen"]
description: Names of each face on the card. Meld cards are listed in the order of CardA, Meld, CardB.
Number of the card.

example:
"Flash
Flying
When Angel of Grace enters the battlefield, until end of turn, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
{4}{W}{W}, Exile Angel of Grace from your graveyard: Your life total becomes 10."
description: Text on the card as originally printed.
Type as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.
Power of the creature.
List of sets the card was printed in, in uppercase.
Rarity. Can be basic, common, uncommon, rare, or mythic
Declartion of rules for the specific card.
A universal unique id (v4) generated by Scryfall. Note that cards with multiple faces are not unique.
Identifier of the side. Used on cards with multiple faces, such as flip, split, transform cards. Can be a, b, or c.
Is the card only not found in a booster pack? Can be true or false. (If false, it is usually omitted.)
List of card subtypes found after em-dash.
List of card supertypes found before em-dash.
Numeric identifier for the card for TCGPlayer.
URL which redirects to TCGPlayer website’s card page.

example:
"Flash
Flying
When Angel of Grace enters the battlefield, until end of turn, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
{4}{W}{W}, Exile Angel of Grace from your graveyard: Your life total becomes 10."
description: Rules text of the card.
Toughness of the card.
Type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.
List of types of the card.
A universal unique id (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique.
uuid field of cards with alternate printings with the same set code (excluding Un-sets).

Name of the watermark on the card. Can be one of many different values, including a guild name, clan name, or wotc for the shooting star. (If there isn’t one, it can be an empty string, but it is usually omitted.)
